clinical_study.brief_title: SASS 2 : Self Assembled Skin Substitute for the Autologous Treatment of Severe Burn Wounds in Acute Stage of Burn Trauma
clinical_study.official_title: SASS 2 : Self Assembled Skin Substitute for the Autologous Treatment of Severe Burn Wounds in Acute Stage of Burn Trauma.

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial is designed to assess the safety, effectiveness and benefits of Self Assembled Skin Substitute SASS grafts as a permanent skin replacement for the treatment of full-thickness burn wounds that require permanent coverage where the availability of donor sites is limited.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of graft take site A vs site B
Percentage of graft take of all SASS
Percentage of graft take according to sites

secondary_outcome.measure: Scar evaluation site A vs site B
secondary_outcome.description: Vancouver Scar Scales; Cutometer; Mexameter; Dermascan; Images;

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events site A vs site B
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical assessment: Infection, Hematoma below the graft, corrective surgery, inclusion of cysts, granulation buds, other

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical assessment: Infection, Hematoma below the graft, corrective surgery, inclusion of cysts, granulation buds, other

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio harvested surface vs covered surface

arm_group.description: All patients will receive both Self assembled skin substitute (SASS) and Split-thickness autograft (paired samples).
All patients will receive both SASS and Split-thickness autograft (paired samples).

intervention.description: Two site A / B, an area of about 50-100 cm2 are selected. The two sites are side by side and subjected to similar stresses. The type of graft (split thickness autograft or SASS) for the site A or B has been determined in advance.
